snippet: Wines produced in a rocky, arid region on the edge of the Gobi Desert have won prestigious awards, and foreign investors have taken notice.
abstract: Silver Heights Winery in Ningxia, China, is among first in country to apply sophisticated Western winemaking techniques; Ningxia, on edge of Gobi Desert, has aspirations to become Napa Valley of China, with local winemakers winning awards and plans afoot to double region's vineyards and create tourism hub.

byline.contributor: This article was reported with support from the McGraw Center for Business Journalism at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism.

lead_paragraph: Wines produced in a rocky, arid region on the edge of the Gobi Desert have won prestigious awards, and foreign investors have taken notice.

headline.main: China’s Winemakers Seek Their Own Napa Valley
headline.print_headline: Growing a Napa Valley in China
